image.altText: A close up of a hand holding a electoral brochure

props.synopsis: As the state heads to the polls for the 2024 Queensland election, around 30 per cent of booths won't be fully accessible.

title.children: 'Humiliating': Voting access for Queenslanders with a disability 'not sufficient'

image.altText: A sign reading Wippo Creek stands on bare ground amid sparce, low scrub with four-wheel drive vehicles in the background.

props.synopsis: A missing Kimberley man was likely met with "foul play" while on a pig hunting trip with six other men, a Queensland coroner has ruled.

title.children: Missing man likely met 'foul play' on illegal hunting trip in outback Queensland, coroner finds

image.altText: A woman with slight smile and glasses looks at the camera.

props.synopsis: Voters in Townsville have turned out in droves to cast an early ballot, fuelled by frustrations over youth crime and a deep desire for change.

title.children: When Townsville mum Jamarah became a victim of crime, her vote was decided

image.altText: A jockey wearing purple colours riding a grey horse.

props.synopsis: The death of Carly-Mae Pye after a fall on the racetrack rocked the Australian horse racing industry. But her memory and legacy lives on every day.

title.children: Heartbroken partner of fallen jockey remembers how beautiful horsewoman 'died doing what she wanted to do'

image.altText: Man standing in checked blue and white shirt with white cowboy hat

props.synopsis: LNP candidate Sean Dillon says he was assaulted on a remote road in outback Queensland.

title.children: Police investigate alleged assault of Queensland LNP candidate

image.altText: Floral tributes that were left at the scene.

props.synopsis: David George Connolly, 43, died after being wounded in the chest by the then 17-year-old boy on Newmarket Road in Wilston in 2023.

title.children: Teenager who stabbed a man with a 40-centimetre knife in Brisbane's inner north found guilty of manslaughter

image.altText: A blue and yellow card with the faces of David Crisafulli and Ros Bates along with a list of candidates.

props.synopsis: The issue of abortion has dogged the LNP during the campaign, with LNP leader David Crisafulli refusing to rule out a conscience vote where MPs are not forced to toe the party line should they win government.

title.children: LNP health spokeswoman preferences party that is anti-abortion second on how-to-vote card

image.altText: Two police officers in a tin boat in the river

props.synopsis: The 18-year-old drowned in Townsville's Ross River while fleeing police in 2022. A coronial inquest has heard it is unlikely that his death could have been prevented.

title.children: Inquest hears no evidence of police misconduct in drowning death of young Indigenous man

image.altText: Woman outside a wooden hall.

props.synopsis: With environmental issues front of mind for some voters, and others firm believers in a resources-led future, Far North Queensland's four state seats are all up for grabs in the October 26 poll.

title.children: Far North Queensland political 'melting pot' emerges as key battleground in state election

image.altText: A group of reporters stand together in front of a banner.

props.synopsis: From news, analysis and explainers through to election previews, key electorates and candidates, Queensland Votes has the latest on the upcoming state election. Click through to read more.

title.children: Queensland Votes 2024 — read, watch and listen to the latest election news and analysis

image.altText: A close up of a green sea turtles face with red dots on the scales.

props.synopsis: The artificial intelligence used for passport facial scanning is now helping Australian conservationists track elusive sea turtles.

title.children: Uncovering the mysteries of the deep with a little help from AI

image.altText: Bowie the blind Australian Shepherd

props.synopsis: Maximilliano Cardozo was charged with ransacking a family's home, stealing their car and driving their pet dog interstate during an alleged burglary, but walked free from court after being found unfit to stand trial.

title.children: Charges dropped against man accused of stealing blind dog during alleged home break-in

image.altText: A young woman with dark brown hair smiles for a portrait.

props.synopsis: Easing the cost of living and making it more attainable for young people to buy a house will be the deciding factors for some young voters on October 26.

title.children: 'My future's been taken away': Concerns for young voters ahead of Queensland election

image.altText: Two men in suits waving to the crowd.

props.synopsis: In a Queensland election debate devoid of big moments, both leaders tried to wedge each other on familiar ground.

title.children: Miles and Crisafulli used their debate to drive home messages but didn't deviate far from the script

image.altText: A baby and toy puppy laying on a bed

props.synopsis: After surviving a risky heart surgery at just one week of age, Seth McMaster is living a full and active life. He wants his journey to offer comfort to other families affected by congenital heart disease.

title.children: When Seth was born his tiny heart beat the odds. Now his life is giving others hope

image.altText: A pile of demolition waste from a house.

props.synopsis: Authorities began investigating the Asbestos Demolition Specialists in 2020 and found large amounts of asbestos waste had been disposed of at a property south of Brisbane.

title.children: Demolition company fined $400,000 for illegal asbestos dumping south of Brisbane

image.altText: Queensland leaders debate

props.synopsis: Premier Steven Miles and Opposition Leader David Crisafulli trade barbs over health, cost of living, housing, energy and abortion ahead of the Queensland state election.

title.children: Abortion laws, housing prices and 'slogan salad': Five takeaways from Queensland's election debate

image.altText: A koala going through a swing door

props.synopsis: A unique collaboration in south-east Queensland will introduce one-way escape hatches so the marsupials can travel to their breeding spots without doubling back into traffic.

title.children: Queensland to trial 'koala doggy doors' to reduce roadkill rates

image.altText: woman smiling wearing t-shirt in building with balloons background

props.synopsis: The electoral commission found Sunshine Coast Mayor Rosanna Natoli accepted prohibited donations from a property developer. The high-profile mayor has defended her conduct.

title.children: Queensland mayor forced to repay $5,000 for 'unintentionally' breaching donation laws

image.altText: A family photo with four people - Danniel, his two children and his wife Caitland on a white bed smiling.

props.synopsis: A Brisbane inquiry has heard that four defence members killed in a defence helicopter crash were experiencing "hazardous" fatigue levels.

title.children: Brisbane inquiry into fatal army helicopter crash reveals men were flying at 'hazardous' fatigue levels

props.synopsis: Environmental protestors who disrupted the Queensland Parliament nearly two years ago have escaped a jail term. It's part of wider national debate about how authorities are clamping down on climate protests.

title.children: Environmental protestors who disrupted Queensland Parliament escape jail term

image.altText: Jann Stuckey estimates

props.synopsis: Jann Stuckey, a former Newman government minister, says the Liberal National Party's key election pitch could raise questions about judicial independence.

title.children: 'Catchy slogan': Former LNP minister questions how Crisafulli's key crime policy will work

image.altText: Cars driving on a highway

props.synopsis: Queensland drivers are hopeful headaches and honking horns on a notoriously busy stretch of the Bruce Highway will be a thing of the past as the long-awaited Gympie Bypass opens.

title.children: Drivers excited as new $1.2b Gympie Bypass slashes commute times

image.altText: A family photo of two parents and three young children, against the backdrop of a blue beach.

props.synopsis: Jess Meikle, her husband, their five-year-old twins and four-year-old have embarked on an Australian caravanning extravaganza.

title.children: What's the best age to take your kids on a family gap year?

image.altText: View across the water with surfers in the foreground paddling and the highrises of Surfers Paradiose in the background

props.synopsis: Locals' bitterness about the southern Gold Coast's rapid transformation could flip this LNP seat to an independent in the upcoming state election.

title.children: Growing pains are crippling the LNP's most marginal Queensland electorate

image.altText: A man standing on a bitumen street wearing a button up shirt and large hat, he has a serious expression on his face

props.synopsis: With both Labor and the LNP based in Brisbane, minor parties and independents are well placed to win over disenfranchised regional voters at the upcoming Queensland election.

title.children: A bushman, Pauline Hanson's right-hand man, and the 'mother of teals' eye voter frustration

image.altText: Children enjoying Longreach's Thomson River on a hot day.

props.synopsis: The weather bureau expects temperatures will reach well above average this week and severe storms are also forecast in parts of the state. It is expected to reach 8C above average in Brisbane on Saturday.

title.children: Queenslanders are set for an early taste of summer, but when can we expect some relief from the heat?

image.altText: A woman in a floral archway in a garden setting

props.synopsis: Prior to getting her ADHD diagnosis life was messy, chaotic, and disorganised. But Amanda says her life completely changed when she was prescribed medication to handle her symptoms.

title.children: Amanda says ADHD drugs helped her gain control of her life, but doctors say red tape is preventing getting help

image.altText: A girl in a blue school uniform types on a laptop.

props.synopsis: A Queensland tribunal has found a school didn't discriminate against a school student by requiring females to wear skirts to formal school occasions.

title.children: Queensland student loses discrimination case over school's uniform policy on skirts

image.altText: Oakdale Guest House fire

props.synopsis: Cold case detectives have announced a $500,000 reward for information over a fire at an Ipswich guest house that claimed the lives of five men more than 30 years ago.

title.children: Cold case detectives announce $500,000 reward over 1990 fire that killed five men west of Brisbane

image.altText: An American saltwater crocodile opens its mouth underwater.

props.synopsis: Crocodiles are on the move across Queensland and there is concern people are putting themselves in mortal danger.

title.children: Authorities work to debunk myths amid crackdown on reckless behaviour around crocodiles

image.altText: An older man works on an artwork as a younger, smiling woman watches on.

props.synopsis: More Australians are being diagnosed with dementia and those in cognitive decline can feel frustrated and lonely, but on the Gold Coast an increasing number are finding ways to enjoy themselves.

title.children: How art and music are putting smiles on the faces of people with Australia's second-deadliest disease

image.altText: Anonymous woman lies in a bed with heart rate monitor clipped on finger at the Marie Stopes clinic in Melbourne.

props.synopsis: Abortion has become a surprise subject of debate in the Queensland election – putting an issue that many Australians might have thought was settled, back on the national agenda.

title.children: Abortion has been legal in Queensland since 2018. Why is it suddenly a subject for debate?
